description: Sustainable and Integrated Management of the Mahakam Delta

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local governments and communities have the capacities to adapt to climate change and make inclusive and sustainable environment & energy decisions benefitting in particular under-served populations
subproject.description:
The project is intended to promote local economic development & local livelihoods by addressing the issues of declined mangrove coverage & ecological productivity; conflicts of land use & land tenure; lack of well-coordinated and comprehensive policies on mangrove conservation.
The expected outcomes of the project is the implementation of a sustainable mode of utilization of the natural resources of the Delta, ensuring at the same time that the key ecological functions of the Delta are preserved and that the economic benefits of shrimp and other mangrove resources are maintained on a long-term basis. As the outputs of the implementation, the project is to: (1) develop a framework and a capacity development package intended to assist the Bupati’s Office to review and synergize existing resources, programmes, projects, and action plans targeted at the Mahakam delta; (2) Identify potential overlaps across sectors and potential conflicts among stakeholders; and (3) establish resolution mechanisms towards an integrated approach for the development of local livelihoods based on sustainable management of mangrove resources.

Promote local livelihoods by addressing the issues of declined mangrove coverage; conflicts of land use; pollution and contamination in the delta; declined ecological productivity; as well as the lack of well-coordinated and comprehensive policies on shrimp pond development and mangrove conservation
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Mahakam Delta

subproject.corporate outcome: Development plans and programmes integrate environmentally sustainable solutions in a manner that promotes poverty reduction, MDG achievement and low-emission climate-resilient development
